messages.title: What we have achieved together
messages.content: When you look around, remember what's changed in our city.

messages.title: Why I'm backing Hilary Benn
messages.content: "I know how hard Hilary works locally. Everyone who meets Hilary finds him approachable and always ready to help. It only takes a phone call or a visit to one of his advice surgeries and he will do all he can for you. I also trust him, and wasn't a bit surprised to read that his expenses were 'beyond reproach'. That's what we want in our MP. I will be voting for him again because I know he will carry on making a difference in our community." - Luke Omondi, Local Resident

messages.title: My pledges to you
messages.content: Help to get a job and fair pay, A guarantee on cancer patient times, Diagnosis within one week if your GP suspects you have cancer, Help when we get older, Tackling anti-social behaviour, Cutting the deficit in four years

keyPolicies.policyDescription: A minimum wage. Tax credits for working families. Sure Start and children's centres. Helping the Leeds economy through a difficult recession. We've got everything right? No. We need more local homes and more affordable housing with anti-social behaviour by the actions we have made and a Labour Government helped to make it happen.
Brand new NHS facilities in east Leeds, Beeston, the St George's Centre in Middleton, a walk-in centre in the Light and the new cancer treatment unit at St James's.
Crime down and neighbourhood policing teams in every area.
Funding for regeneration, with new and improved homes coming in Little London and Beeston Hill and Holbeck.
New school buildings for Primrose, South Leeds, and New Bewerley.

issues.economy: A minimum wage. Tax credits for working families. Sure Start and children's centres. Helping the Leeds economy through a difficult recession.
issues.education: New school buildings for Primrose, South Leeds, and New Bewerley.
issues.health: Brand new NHS facilities in east Leeds, Beeston, the St George's Centre in Middleton, a walk-in centre in the Light and the new cancer treatment unit at St James's.

housing.content: Funding for regeneration, with new and improved homes coming in Little London and Beeston Hill and Holbeck.

leaflet.personalStatement: "Life is about the choices we make, and I want to thank you for putting your trust in me as your MP. I have done my best to repay it. I work hard for everyone - all those of you who have asked for my help was know. And I've campaigned for more funding for our schools, NHS and police. At a time of change and uncertainty, we should never forget that Leeds is a great city - full of people who work hard, trying to do the best by their families and neighbours. And what kind of Government we choose at this election really will make a difference to our lives."

contactInformation.address: Hilary Benn, 2 Blenheim Terrace, Leeds LS2 9JG

endorsements.endorsement: "I know how hard Hilary works locally. Everyone who meets Hilary finds him approachable and always ready to help. It only takes a phone call or a visit to one of his advice surgeries and he will do all he can for you. I also trust him, and wasn't a bit surprised to read that his expenses were 'beyond reproach'. That's what we want in our MP. I will be voting for him again because I know he will carry on making a difference in our community."

quotes.text: "Life is about the choices we make, and I want to thank you for putting your trust in me as your MP. I have done my best to repay it. I work hard for everyone - all those of you who have asked for my help was know. And I've campaigned for more funding for our schools, NHS and police. At a time of change and uncertainty, we should never forget that Leeds is a great city - full of people who work hard, trying to do the best by their families and neighbours. And what kind of Government we choose at this election really will make a difference to our lives."
